Summary Welcome Friends, Acquaintances, Mysterious Visitors who have come to see what I'm about! 
 
Philosophically, I’m a believer in the connected unconscious. What drives me is seeing, finding and linking the connections that exist in seemingly disconnected spaces (can someone say siloes?) to solve business problems. It shapes my world view, influences my strategic approach and helps me keep an eye on delivering positive customer experiences and better business outcomes. I don’t believe in an “us” vs. “them”, “business” vs. “customer”, “marketing” vs. “sales”. At any given time, we all take turns in different roles and shouldn’t shut off what we know about being in these various roles just because we want to tow the party line. Using that knowledge to help us better collaborate and connect is what I advocate. Some call this disruptive. I think this is just good business. 
 
In part, that's why I've been drawn to social media. It helps call attention to the fact that people like doing business with other people. Having been in brand development the greater part of my career, I understand the power of the brand. But brand awareness alone is not sufficient. It's also very important to ensure "the brand" gets expressed through how a company delivers its services, products and engages with its customers. Conveying the idea of openness at the brand awareness level and then putting up a wall of austerity and not really helping the customer through their journey is a disconnected experience.  
 
I've been on this journey close to 20 years and still have more to learn. Please read on to find out I worked at some really fantastic companies and graduated from Rutgers, but connect with me directly to find out who I truly am.
